#Text=USA Gymnastics board resigning after sex abuse
#Text=Monday , January 29 , 2018
#Text=Logo of USA GymnasticsImage : USA Gymnastics .
#Text=( Reuseterms . )
#Text=On Friday , USA Gymnastics ( USAG ) — the US national governing body for the sport of gymnastics — issued a statement that it will comply with an ultimatum for its entire board to resign .

#Text=The United States Olympic Committee ( USOC ) issued the ultimatum , in the wake of the sentencing on Wednesday of Larry Nassar for sex abuse , that the entire USAG board must resign within six days or face decertification as the gymnastics national governing body .
#Text=On Wednesday , Larry Nassar was sentenced to prison for 40 to 175 years on seven counts of sexual abuse .
#Text=He is alleged to have well more than 150 victims , however , with a history of sexual abuse of minors going back more than a decade .
#Text=Nassar served as the team physician for USA Gymnastics in a career that spanned four Olympic Games .
#Text=He abused female members of the gymnastics team under pretense of treating them .
#Text=On Thursday , Scott Blackmun , head for the USOC , sent a letter to the USAG board , listing a set of demands .
#Text=" [ W]hile the USOC encourages USA Gymnastics to think and act broadly on reforming its culture , we also believe that reform must start with an entirely new board " , Blackmun wrote .
#Text=" We do not base these requirements on any knowledge that any individual USAG staff or board members had a role in fostering or obscuring Nassar 's actions .

#Text=Our position comes from a clear sense that USAG culture needs fundamental rebuilding .

_	_	_	_

#Text=Although three members of the board had already resigned two days before Nassar 's sentencing , Blackmun insisted on a  categorically fresh start at the board level . "

column1: #Text=The letter gives the USAG board until January 31 to resign .
#Text=By February 28 a new interim board with athlete representation must be seated .
#Text=Blackmun also outlined a number of additional steps demanded by USOC or face immediate decertification .

#Text=These include fully cooperating with independent investigations into the Nassar case , ethics training for all staff and board members , and " SafeSport " anti-abuse ( i.e. bullying , harassment , hazing ) training .

column1: #Text=On Friday , USAG issued the statement on its website , saying it intends to comply :
#Text=" USA Gymnastics supports the United States Olympic Committee 's letter and accepts the absolute need of the Olympic family to promote a safe environment for all of our athletes .

#Text=USA Gymnastics and the USOC have the same goal — making the sport of gymnastics , and others , as safe as possible for athletes to follow their dreams in a safe , positive and empowered environment .
